segment.source: Support your app with background tasks
segment.target: Support your app with background tasks

segment.source: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.
segment.target: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.

segment.source: Support your app with background tasks
segment.target: Support your app with background tasks

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.
segment.target: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.

segment.source: Background tasks are lightweight classes that the OS runs in the background.
segment.target: Background tasks are lightweight classes that the OS runs in the background.

segment.source: You can use background tasks to provide functionality when your app is suspended or not running.
segment.target: You can use background tasks to provide functionality when your app is suspended or not running.

segment.source: You can also use background tasks for real-time communication apps like VOIP, mail, and IM.
segment.target: You can also use background tasks for real-time communication apps like VOIP, mail, and IM.

segment.source: Background tasks are separate classes that implement the IBackgroundTask interface.
segment.target: Background tasks are separate classes that implement the IBackgroundTask interface.

segment.source: You register a background task by using the BackgroundTaskBuilder class.
segment.target: You register a background task by using the BackgroundTaskBuilder class.

segment.source: The class name is used to specify the entry point when you registering the background task.
segment.target: The class name is used to specify the entry point when you registering the background task.

segment.source: To get started quickly with a background task, see Create and register a background task.
segment.target: To get started quickly with a background task, see Create and register a background task.

segment.source: Tip Starting with Windows 10, you no longer need to place an app on the lock screen in order to register background tasks.
segment.target: Tip Starting with Windows 10, you no longer need to place an app on the lock screen in order to register background tasks.

segment.source: Background tasks for system events
segment.target: Background tasks for system events

segment.source: Your app can respond to system-generated events by registering a background task with the SystemTrigger class.
segment.target: Your app can respond to system-generated events by registering a background task with the SystemTrigger class.

segment.source: An app can use any of the following system event triggers (defined in SystemTriggerType)
segment.target: An app can use any of the following system event triggers (defined in SystemTriggerType)

segment.source: Trigger name
segment.target: Trigger name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: InternetAvailable
segment.target: InternetAvailable

segment.source: The Internet becomes available.
segment.target: The Internet becomes available.

segment.source: NetworkStateChange
segment.target: NetworkStateChange

segment.source: A network change such as a change in cost or connectivity occurs.
segment.target: A network change such as a change in cost or connectivity occurs.

segment.source: OnlineIdConnectedStateChange
segment.target: OnlineIdConnectedStateChange

segment.source: Online ID associated with the account changes.
segment.target: Online ID associated with the account changes.

segment.source: SmsReceived
segment.target: SmsReceived

segment.source: A new SMS message is received by an installed mobile broadband device.
segment.target: A new SMS message is received by an installed mobile broadband device.

segment.source: TimeZoneChange
segment.target: TimeZoneChange

segment.source: The time zone changes on the device (for example, when the system adjusts the clock for daylight saving time).
segment.target: The time zone changes on the device (for example, when the system adjusts the clock for daylight saving time).

segment.source: For more info see Respond to system events with background tasks.
segment.target: For more info see Respond to system events with background tasks.

segment.source: Conditions for background tasks
segment.target: Conditions for background tasks

segment.source: You can control when the background task runs, even after it is triggered, by adding a condition.
segment.target: You can control when the background task runs, even after it is triggered, by adding a condition.

segment.source: Once triggered, a background task will not run until all of its conditions are met.
segment.target: Once triggered, a background task will not run until all of its conditions are met.

segment.source: The following conditions (represented by the SystemConditionType enumeration) can be used.
segment.target: The following conditions (represented by the SystemConditionType enumeration) can be used.

segment.source: Condition name
segment.target: Condition name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: InternetAvailable
segment.target: InternetAvailable

segment.source: The Internet must be available.
segment.target: The Internet must be available.

segment.source: InternetNotAvailable
segment.target: InternetNotAvailable

segment.source: The Internet must be unavailable.
segment.target: The Internet must be unavailable.

segment.source: SessionConnected
segment.target: SessionConnected

segment.source: The session must be connected.
segment.target: The session must be connected.

segment.source: SessionDisconnected
segment.target: SessionDisconnected

segment.source: The session must be disconnected.
segment.target: The session must be disconnected.

segment.source: UserNotPresent
segment.target: UserNotPresent

segment.source: The user must be away.
segment.target: The user must be away.

segment.source: UserPresent
segment.target: UserPresent

segment.source: The user must be present.
segment.target: The user must be present.

segment.source: For more info see Set conditions for running a background task.
segment.target: For more info see Set conditions for running a background task.

segment.source: Application manifest requirements
segment.target: Application manifest requirements

segment.source: Before your app can successfully register a background task, it must be declared in the application manifest.
segment.target: Before your app can successfully register a background task, it must be declared in the application manifest.

segment.source: For more info see Declare background tasks in the application manifest.
segment.target: For more info see Declare background tasks in the application manifest.

segment.source: Background tasks
segment.target: Background tasks

segment.source: The following real-time triggers can be used to run lightweight custom code in the background:
segment.target: The following real-time triggers can be used to run lightweight custom code in the background:

segment.source: Control Channel: Background tasks can keep a connection alive, and receive messages on the control channel, by using the ControlChannelTrigger.
segment.target: Control Channel: Background tasks can keep a connection alive, and receive messages on the control channel, by using the ControlChannelTrigger.

segment.source: If your app is listening to a socket, you can use the Socket Broker instead of the ControlChannelTrigger.
segment.target: If your app is listening to a socket, you can use the Socket Broker instead of the ControlChannelTrigger.

segment.source: For more details on using the Socket Broker, see SocketActivityTrigger.
segment.target: For more details on using the Socket Broker, see SocketActivityTrigger.

segment.source: The ControlChannelTrigger is not supported on Windows Phone.
segment.target: The ControlChannelTrigger is not supported on Windows Phone.

segment.source: Timer: Background tasks can run as frequently as every 15 minutes, and they can be set to run at a certain time by using the TimeTrigger.
segment.target: Timer: Background tasks can run as frequently as every 15 minutes, and they can be set to run at a certain time by using the TimeTrigger.

segment.source: For more info see Run a background task on a timer.
segment.target: For more info see Run a background task on a timer.

segment.source: Push Notification: Background tasks respond to the PushNotificationTrigger to receive raw push notifications.
segment.target: Push Notification: Background tasks respond to the PushNotificationTrigger to receive raw push notifications.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.
segment.target: Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.

segment.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.
segment.target: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.

segment.source: For more information, see Guidelines for background tasks.
segment.target: For more information, see Guidelines for background tasks.

segment.source: System event triggers
segment.target: System event triggers

segment.source: Note The SystemTriggerType enumeration includes the following system event triggers.
segment.target: Note The SystemTriggerType enumeration includes the following system event triggers.

segment.source: Trigger name
segment.target: Trigger name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: UserPresent
segment.target: UserPresent

segment.source: The background task is triggered when the user becomes present.
segment.target: The background task is triggered when the user becomes present.

segment.source: UserAway
segment.target: UserAway

segment.source: The background task is triggered when the user becomes absent.
segment.target: The background task is triggered when the user becomes absent.

segment.source: ControlChannelReset
segment.target: ControlChannelReset

segment.source: The background task is triggered when a control channel is reset.
segment.target: The background task is triggered when a control channel is reset.

segment.source: SessionConnected
segment.target: SessionConnected

segment.source: The background task is triggered when the session is connected.
segment.target: The background task is triggered when the session is connected.

segment.source: The following system event triggers make it possible to recognize when the user has moved an app on or off the lock screen.
segment.target: The following system event triggers make it possible to recognize when the user has moved an app on or off the lock screen.

segment.source: Trigger name
segment.target: Trigger name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: LockScreenApplicationAdded
segment.target: LockScreenApplicationAdded

segment.source: An app tile is added to the lock screen.
segment.target: An app tile is added to the lock screen.

segment.source: LockScreenApplicationRemoved
segment.target: LockScreenApplicationRemoved

segment.source: An app tile is removed from the lock screen.
segment.target: An app tile is removed from the lock screen.

segment.source: Background task resource constraints
segment.target: Background task resource constraints

segment.source: Background tasks are lightweight.
segment.target: Background tasks are lightweight.

segment.source: Keeping background execution to a minimum ensures the best user experience with foreground apps and battery life.
segment.target: Keeping background execution to a minimum ensures the best user experience with foreground apps and battery life.

segment.source: This is enforced by applying resource constraints to background tasks:
segment.target: This is enforced by applying resource constraints to background tasks:

segment.source: Background tasks are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage.
segment.target: Background tasks are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage.

segment.source: Additional background task resource constraints
segment.target: Additional background task resource constraints

segment.source: Memory constraints
segment.target: Memory constraints

segment.source: Due to the resource constraints for low-memory devices, background tasks may have a memory limit that determines the maximum amount of memory the background task can use.
segment.target: Due to the resource constraints for low-memory devices, background tasks may have a memory limit that determines the maximum amount of memory the background task can use.

segment.source: If your background task attempts an operation that would exceed this limit, the operation will fail and may generate an out-of-memory exception that the task can handle.
segment.target: If your background task attempts an operation that would exceed this limit, the operation will fail and may generate an out-of-memory exception that the task can handle.

segment.source: If the task does not handle the out-of-memory exception, or the nature of the attempted operation is such that an out-of-memory exception was not generated, then the task will be terminated immediately.
segment.target: If the task does not handle the out-of-memory exception, or the nature of the attempted operation is such that an out-of-memory exception was not generated, then the task will be terminated immediately.

segment.source: You can use the MemoryManager APIs to query your current memory usage and limit in order to discover your cap (if any), and to monitor your background task's ongoing memory usage.
segment.target: You can use the MemoryManager APIs to query your current memory usage and limit in order to discover your cap (if any), and to monitor your background task's ongoing memory usage.

segment.source: Per-device limit for apps with background tasks for low-memory devices
segment.target: Per-device limit for apps with background tasks for low-memory devices

segment.source: On memory-constrained devices, there is a limit to the number of apps that can be installed on a device and use background tasks at any given time.
segment.target: On memory-constrained devices, there is a limit to the number of apps that can be installed on a device and use background tasks at any given time.

segment.source: If this number is exceeded, the call to RequestAccessAsync, which is required to register all background tasks, will fail.
segment.target: If this number is exceeded, the call to RequestAccessAsync, which is required to register all background tasks, will fail.

segment.source: Battery Saver
segment.target: Battery Saver

segment.source: Unless you exempt your app so that it can still run background tasks and receive push notifications when Battery Saver is on, the Battery Saver feature, when enabled, will prevent background tasks from running when the device is not connected to external power and the battery goes below a specified amount of power remaining.
segment.target: Unless you exempt your app so that it can still run background tasks and receive push notifications when Battery Saver is on, the Battery Saver feature, when enabled, will prevent background tasks from running when the device is not connected to external power and the battery goes below a specified amount of power remaining.

segment.source: This will not prevent you from registering background tasks.
segment.target: This will not prevent you from registering background tasks.

segment.source: Background task resource guarantees for real-time communication
segment.target: Background task resource guarantees for real-time communication

segment.source: To prevent resource quotas from interfering with real-time communication functionality, background tasks using the ControlChannelTrigger and PushNotificationTrigger receive guaranteed CPU resource quotas for every running task.
segment.target: To prevent resource quotas from interfering with real-time communication functionality, background tasks using the ControlChannelTrigger and PushNotificationTrigger receive guaranteed CPU resource quotas for every running task.

segment.source: The resource quotas are as mentioned above, and remain constant for these background tasks.
segment.target: The resource quotas are as mentioned above, and remain constant for these background tasks.

segment.source: Your app doesn't have to do anything differently to get the guaranteed resource quotas for ControlChannelTrigger and PushNotificationTrigger background tasks.
segment.target: Your app doesn't have to do anything differently to get the guaranteed resource quotas for ControlChannelTrigger and PushNotificationTrigger background tasks.

segment.source: The system always treats these as critical background tasks.
segment.target: The system always treats these as critical background tasks.

segment.source: Maintenance trigger
segment.target: Maintenance trigger

segment.source: Maintenance tasks only run when the device is plugged in to AC power.
segment.target: Maintenance tasks only run when the device is plugged in to AC power.

segment.source: For more info see Use a maintenance trigger.
segment.target: For more info see Use a maintenance trigger.

segment.source: Background task for sensors and devices
segment.target: Background task for sensors and devices

segment.source: Your app can access sensors and peripheral devices from a background task with the DeviceUseTrigger class.
segment.target: Your app can access sensors and peripheral devices from a background task with the DeviceUseTrigger class.

segment.source: You can use this trigger for long-running operations such as data synchronization or monitoring.
segment.target: You can use this trigger for long-running operations such as data synchronization or monitoring.

segment.source: Unlike tasks for system events, a DeviceUseTrigger task can only be triggered while your app is running in the foreground and no conditions can be set on it.
segment.target: Unlike tasks for system events, a DeviceUseTrigger task can only be triggered while your app is running in the foreground and no conditions can be set on it.

segment.source: Some critical device operations, such as long running firmware updates, cannot be performed with the DeviceUseTrigger.
segment.target: Some critical device operations, such as long running firmware updates, cannot be performed with the DeviceUseTrigger.

segment.source: Such operations can be performed only on the PC, and only by a privileged app that uses the DeviceServicingTrigger.
segment.target: Such operations can be performed only on the PC, and only by a privileged app that uses the DeviceServicingTrigger.

segment.source: A privileged app is an app that the device's manufacturer has authorized to perform those operations.
segment.target: A privileged app is an app that the device's manufacturer has authorized to perform those operations.

segment.source: Device metadata is used to specify which app, if any, has been designated as the privileged app for a device.
segment.target: Device metadata is used to specify which app, if any, has been designated as the privileged app for a device.

segment.source: For more info, see Device sync and update for Windows Store device apps
segment.target: For more info, see Device sync and update for Windows Store device apps

segment.source: Managing background tasks
segment.target: Managing background tasks

segment.source: Background tasks can report progress, completion, and cancellation to your app using events and local storage.
segment.target: Background tasks can report progress, completion, and cancellation to your app using events and local storage.

segment.source: Your app can also catch exceptions thrown by a background task, and manage background task registration during app updates.
segment.target: Your app can also catch exceptions thrown by a background task, and manage background task registration during app updates.

segment.source: For more info see:
segment.target: For more info see:

segment.source: Handle a cancelled background task
segment.target: Handle a cancelled background task

segment.source: Monitor background task progress and completion
segment.target: Monitor background task progress and completion

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
segment.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
